Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for comfort, cleanliness, location & value”
Reviews.Author: Gina B
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Al Canal Regio Hotel. I am really surprised to read comments from other travellers who have something negative to say. I stayed at Easter 2011 and just arranged for my parents to stay there at Easter 2012. The staff recognised the connection and upgraded my parents to a room with a view. Their experience was just as brilliant as ours: very friendly staff (Marco & Michele), clean, modern & comfortable rooms, excellent location and overall superb value for money. I will always return to this hotel & recommend it to my friends and colleagues. Grazie mille to the staff at Al Canal Regio! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sonia B
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Al Canal Regio during our 5 trip to Venice. We both enjoyed this hotel, the great location away from the crowds, the extremely friendly staff (thank you Marco and MichÃ¨le) and our great room. We had to leave at 6 am this morning to catch an early flight so couldn't make it for breakfast (served from 8:30 am till 10:30 am) but staff provided us with a tray in our room and fresh food in the fridge so we didn't have to leave on an empty stomach. It's true the reception is not covered at night but we got very clear instructions on how to open/close to entrance to the courtyard and there's a number you can call for assistance. We had absolutely no problem with this arrangement and felt very, very safe in this quiet part of Venice. Remember that Venice in general is an expensive city to stay in (far more expensive than e.g. London or Paris) so I recommend to book well in advance to get a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Al Canal Regio, Venice totally misrepresents itself on web!!!”
Reviews.Author: CherylJavadi
Reviews.Content: The Al Canal Regio Hotel is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. My daughter and I arrived at 8:30 pm to find our keys laying out on the desk with a note to take our key and go to our room. They said the front desk is not covered after 6:00 pm. They require all guests to leave their keys in a bowl at the desk in the lobby when leaving the hotel. The hotel door is open and anyone could walk in and go into anyones room. I felt very unsafe. Not only was there a safety issue, but the room was horrible. Our room was on first floor directly behind the checkin desk. The bed was a double, which two people would be bumping butts all night long, and no comforter only a very thin dirty looking spread. If I wanted to compare this hotel to one we are all familiar with, I'd say the Holiday Inn would feel like the Ritz compared to the Al Canal Regio Hotel. They did not truthfully represent their hotel on their website. It is nothing like the photos. Which makes everything worse is the young man who we spoke with the next day was rude and unreasonable. We never stayed in the our room and they would not reimburse us for any of the three nights. I could not stay in a hotel which had such a security issue. We used our Iphone and found another hotel that evening and quickly moved over to the Sofitel which is a beautiful hotel. The bed was a king size with a comforter which was huge and fluffy. I would strongly recommend not booking the Al Canal Regio Hotel. You will be disappointed and they could care less. The Al Canal Regio Hotel is unsafe, dirty and with rude staff. Way too much money for what you will get. Try the Sofitel.....you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-spacious modern room”
Reviews.Author: Lily523
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and despite all negative comments on this site, I must say that we had a very enjoyable stay. Our room was spacious, the bathroom very modern and tidy (superb bathtube), a great bed/mattrass and breakfast according to Italian standards more than sufficient (croissants, ham, cheese, yoghurt etc.). We stayed in a superior room with garden - ok, it is not a real garden instead a small courtyard, but what do you expect in a city like Venice where you can count all gardens on 2 hands? Thanks to this courtyard, we could open our outsidedoor day and night! It is true that the receptionist is not present anymore from 6 pm on, but be honest: do you really need a receptionist at night? In short: the hotel has a great location moreover it is very quiet in this area. The room was cozy and well furnished and our bathroom very modern and tidy. If you are looking for a hotel with a 24 hour fake smiling receptionist and a dull room then please book a room at the unpersonal Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, do not believe all the reports”
Reviews.Author: HMTcassie
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at this hotel and cannot believe the bad reviews we read, neither could several others staying there at the same time. This hotel is good value for money. The standard is excellent for this type of hotel, and comparable to other hotels I have stayed at in Italy. The photos do do justice to the hotel. The staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful, both on the phone before we arrived and for our entire stay of five days. Although the water heating broke, they tried everything to get it repaired, but this is Italy, and Venice, and they could not get a plumber to come out on a Sunday, this is usual for Italy, and for such things they need to be treated as part of the 'adventure' and do not blame the hotel. The so called 'alley' on other comments is a Venitian street, it is small, but you have come to Venice, and are in a residential area. The hotel is excellent for being quiet, away from the crowds of tourists, off the main street, but close to the water bus stop for easy access or for walking to main sites. The hotel is wheelchair accessible, but does not have any special adaptations, so if you can weight bare this is a very good option. Although a lot of Venice will be difficult there are accessible options and ramped bridges in some parts. Some bridges do have platform lifts for wheelchairs, but we did not find one that worked. There is one 'assisted' bridge between the hotel and the water bus at Ca d'Oro I was able to get over this both in a powered wheelchair and being pushed, with very little difficulty. For others with mobility difficulties a ground floor room here is an excellent option. We did opt, despite the expense, to have a water taxi to get from the train station as we did not know where things were, or the accessibility (I recomend Flavio in taxi 21) but got the water bus back with no problem. All water buses are accessible, but be prepared for them to be very crowded. All the bus staff help you get on and off and were in the main great. The breakfast was very good and an Italian continental breakfast there was enough and the staff replenished if things ran out. Near by there are several excellent restaurants and I recomend Osteria Al Osti as accessible and apart from teh one before mentioned bridge no steps to get to. Very very good quality food and prices very very reasonable for Venice, a pasta dish with fresh sea food costs about 12 euros. Luigi is teh fantastic waiter and be prepared for a laugh. I would stringly recommend this hotel to people, but do adivse to remember this is Italy life goes at a different pace. Star ratings do not mean the same as other places. I understand looking at the bad comments they were mostly from last minute bookers, remember in Europe if you book at the last minute you will usually get a small room in the attic if you want the access you need to book as early as possible with the hotel or booking.com etc

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: footie1990
Reviews.Content: Just came back form Italy. Stay at this property ruined our impression about Venice. We paid a lot of money. The walls of the room were dirty, bathroom handle was broken. Bathroom smelled pretty bad. Small window was under the sidewalk. Practically room was located underground. The room furniture was wery cheap- Wallmart type.There is no clerk on duty after 6 p.m. Front office clerk-Marco was very unfriendly. He denied all our complaints. When I mentioned that his behavior is unnacceptable, he said that he is paying back to my unfriendly complaints. I travelled a lot. Very disappointing. Do not ruin your vacation. Stay away from this property.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sgeorge1
Reviews.Content: This hotel really does seems to be 'hit or miss' - having read the views before we booked we hoped it would be a positive experience unfortunately it was a 'miss'! Shame, as Venice really is a once in a lifetime place to visit and wanted it to be amazing. We booked a superior room, on the hotel website this was described as including every amenity, superior courtesy kit and chocolate candy in the evening. We arrived late and it wasn't until the morning we realised some of the amenities were missing. In our experience a standard room just turns into a superior by adding a kettle and a shower cap. All amenities didn't include :- kettle, minibar, bathrobe or chocolates. Top tips, Venice is very expensive but move away from the crowds and prices drop, lovely local cafe on a Sunday morning is 'the Dodo cafe'. Wear comfortable shoes, eat in Cannaregio and take a Gondola trip away from the Grand Canal. If you are pushing the boat out arrive in style on a water taxi - it's a perfect start to your time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Maiicol
Reviews.Content: We went to venezia my girlfriend and i to visit the viennale, we got the canal view that is indeed a little expencive but it its fair to say that has been the best room that we came across in our hole visit to italy. The staff is very well informed about everything in venezia an is very non intrucive fact that we were very thankfull for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Vasco1975
Reviews.Content: In spite of some bad reviews on this hotel, i've stayed here with my six year old kid and everything went just perfect. The room was clean, the bathroom spacious, no problem with noise and the staff were just ok. I guess people just overreact when they're on holidays...

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but over priced for quality”
Reviews.Author: by_jess
Reviews.Content: We were not originally booked to stay in this hotel but due to electrical issues at Casa Martini Hotel we were transferred here for one night (both hotels have the same owner). The hotel is in a typical Venetian house and area. It was not difficult to find, the area (Cannaregio) was very safe and lively with good shops and restaurants as well as the only McDonalds in Venice nearby (if that's your thing). Our room was nicely furnished but not as luxurious as it seems on the web site (it photographs deceivingly well). We had an in room safe with an outlet for a notebook computer but the outlet did not work. The TV was nice but had no English channels (same at Casa Martini). Not a big deal. The bed is two single beds pushed together, pretty typical for a European hotel. My one complaint about the room was that it was not well cleaned. The floors were dirty, as well as table surfaces. Bathroom was adequate but had that annoying shower head that does not set into the wall so had to be held the entire time. Two towels and two hand towels were provided but no bath mat or face cloths. Water pressure and temperature were fine. Our room overlooked the street below as well as the private courtyard of one of the superior rooms. Air conditioning worked great and windows were large and bright. The hotel itself has a small interior courtyard which was plain and had filing cabinets and other miscellaneous materials stored in it (not very luxurious looking). The room where breakfast was served was comfortable. Breakfast was hot drinks, juices (dispensed), cereal, croissants, biscuits, cured meat, sliced cheese, yogurt, canned pineapple, dates, etc. Unfortunately when we arrived for breakfast (8:30 am) there were no clean dishes left so we had to eat our food on napkins. Breakfast should have been better organized. We had a similar problem at Casa Martini - except that there were no dishes left and no food left at 9 am. Staff were fine to deal with (don't except anything too friendly, this is Europe after all, and that's part of the charm!) Spoke fairly good English. Keys had to be left in a bowl at reception but this is fairly normal for European hotels and we found it to be fine. There is no 24 hour reception at this hotel so you must buzz at the front door to gain access after reception hours. Again, fairly normal. Overall, using trendy furnishings and a nice web site does not make a hotel luxurious. This hotel is probably not worth the price (in high season). If you're going to stay in Venice do it right - its a beautiful city and where you stay does impact your overall impression of your vacation in the end. If you are looking for an average hotel this one is fine.

Reviews.Title: “RED ALERT, REVIEWS SPEAK FOR THEMSELVES”
Reviews.Author: Kumbada
Reviews.Content: Over all the years I have travelled I have never had the experience that I have had before with this hotel. After returning I read the reviews (mayb should have done this before) and I can only agree with every negative comment, I feel postive ones must be posted by the owners. When we arrived we where greeted with a man from reception, he copied all our passports including childrens and then told we had to walk about 10 mins to our room.... Well when we arrived I was in total shock, nothing at all like the website pictures, within minutes my son could not breath with asthma and had to go outside. I myself could not have slept there. I told the young man that took us there I was not staying there and then we headed back to reception. When while I leave my family at McDonalds whilst I sort it out. Our friendly reception man was not so friendly now and said that I could have the only room left, i said we wont all fit he said 3 in double bed and 1 in roll away I asked for a extra roll away but he said no and I would need to pay for another room (so now they do have other rooms). I asked to see the other room, both very basic rooms right on reception, back I go to the family and we look online for another hotel and then decided after travelling already for 9 hours we had had enough so just pay the extra which a lastminute special on their website advertised 80 euro. So back I go to the hotel to organise it, when I arrive I said okay we will take the extra room, but now he wants to charge more...... I said your own website says 80 euro, he said well go back to your family and book it then... Great customer service skills..... so off i head and make the booking and then we all head back for the fouth time and when we arrive guess what carnt have that room its another room. He isnt doing too bad coming up with rooms considering he only had 1 to begin with.. Dont expect anything to happens that is mentioned on the website as you will be disappointed, No welcome drink, no map, no turndown service or no chocolate candy just to mention a few, and found no sercurity at night even after calling out. The 3 garbage bags of rubbish sat near the front reception for the 2 days we where there, I think that in itselfs says alot. The only good thing about this hotel is location, but there are plenty of other hotels here, so our advice is choose another hotel. Very poor service by this hotel and lies by staff made our Venice trip very disappointing, but it also extends to everything you do in Venice. It has the mentality to rip off tourist and they don't care if you ever come again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in venice.”
Reviews.Author: tintin84
Reviews.Content: After spending hours looking for the hotel we finally found it very much off the tourist track in a seedy ally with rubbish everywhere and smelling of urine, we attempted to check into the hotel but found the hotel unattended and after waiting for 20 minutes someone came to check us in, The guy who showed up offered no apology but demanded our passports and then started reeling off rules about the hotel. When you leave the hotel you should leave your room key in a blow with the rest of them alarm bells started ringing then. what sort of hotel does that? We finally get checked in and shown to our room (4s) and we get shown up a narrow stairway with no working lights to a room if you can call it that. more like a broom cupboard with not a bed but a sofa bed in it. the heat in the room was crazy the air-conditioning was not working and only would work while you are in the room so when you have had a day out you come back to a hot room the same goes for the fridge. We quickly dumped our stuff and left the hotel once again the checkin guy Marco was not there. so we contacted the company we booked it through and explained the situation to them and they said that it was unacceptable how the hotel was, with how the website listed it and what we were lacking Room Service Air Conditioning Balcony Cable television City Map Climate Control Duvets DVD Player Free bottle of wine Free Internet access Safe with notebook plug Coffee/tea facilities Telephone Television Turndown service Under-floor heating Wake-up calls High speed internet connection Work Desk Work desk with lamp Modem Access Hairdryer Mini-bar Safe Separate Hanging Closet Heating Refrigerator Magnifying glass Free safe box with laptop capacity. Many of the above mentioned items are what you would expect as a a basic 3 star hotel but were all lacking in the room. They contacted the hotel and got a response that it was very rude that we did not contact the hotel directly and address our concerns, difficult to do since the hotel is unattended 90% of the time. Apparently we were offered by Marco an apartment when checking in which never happened and i explained this to Lastminute.com. We were also advised that if we wanted to change rooms we would need to pay for a room that had a real bed. What sort of hotel uses a sofa bed? On our way back to the hotel of a night we walk through the alley to the hotel and get confronted by people urinating in the street outside the hotel which is disgusting to say the least. We checked out of the hotel at the end of our 3 day stay on the worlds most uncomfortable sofa bed, went to reception to check out and was greeted by a different receptionist who just presented the bill to us without a word. when i pointed out that the bill said Apartment and we stayed in a room he lost the will to speak english conveniently. So we payed up and left. Since returning home I have been in contact with the booking agent Lastminute.com about this hotel and submitted pictures of the room to them showing the substandard room that is being sold via them. They have since been in contact with the hotel repeatedly but have had no luck getting anything out of them but excuses from the hotel manager Marco. Even Lastminute.com are being given the runaround from this poor excuse of a hotel. They have since referred it to one of the destination managers to actually go to the hotel and inspect the room we stayed in (4s) and the hotel as it is substandard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel.....Cant ask for better”
Reviews.Author: jackiebartolo
Reviews.Content: It might not be a 5 star hotel and maybe the receptionist is not all the time in his place :)....But its simply perfect ,Clean, Romantic,Rooms are big...What else just PERFECT...Its impossible to find it..But it u ask for directions before u get in venice they will send them via email and ull find it..And ppl in venice are all in a hurry but they are very helpfull.....Be aware of the high tide take good boots with u.....We could'nt get in the hotel when we arriived tide was to high..But thats what's Venice all about

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: MissySmith
Reviews.Content: First we couldnt find it, dont go by google maps!! It took us an hour to find it, witht the help of a nice man from denmark and his ipad. Once you fine it it looks pretty nice, but wait till you get to your room. When we got to our room, the first thing we noticed was that there are no window! We had two skylights, with one that didnt work. We couldnt sleep at night, it was so hot. In the middle of the night i had to go sit next to the door to get some cool air in. Our bathroom door broke, there was no one around the sign on the table on the reception to call 200 on you room phone, we dont have one. So, i went to the buzzer on the outside of the hotel, the man said he'd be there in 5 minutes. After half an hour, I buzzed again. He acted as if I had never called before. So we wait and wait, and mind you its almost midnight, and we'd been out all days. I wanted to go to sleep. My husband goes downstairs and finds a butter knife. He gets the door open and put the handle back on, five minutes later the man shows up. Our TV wouldnt work, the air con wouldnt work. It looked like a office turned into a bedroom. It was clean, and the bathroom pretty modern. This hotel put a damper on our anniversary, I wasnt in the best of mood because I couldnt sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: vicchik
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Al Canal Regio. The manager even upgraded us to a Canal View which made our otherwise rough day of traveling to the island much sweeter! We didn't have heat, but when I inquired at the desk, we were informed that this was due to Venice city regulations during the transition from Winter to Spring, so they brought us more blankets. We loved the location despite the rather hidden alleys that you have to maneuver to find the hotel and thought the staff was very kind and accommodating for our needs. The downsides that I noticed were that the shower was a bit short & small and I'm only 5'6", so I would not want to be the 6' traveler who tries to squeeze in.. and yes, leaving the key in the bowl when you leave made us feel uncomfortable but there was a safe in the room so we just made sure to use it! We did enjoy our stay here and would definitely tell our friends about it!

Reviews.Title: “Poor excuse for a hotel room - they should be ashamed. Stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Emmylu1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Lastminute.com, which offered us the option of a 'double' or a 'small double' - there were no further distinguishing details provided on lastminute or the hotel's website (I did check before booking!) so we just assumed the small double would be less spacious, and, not planning to spending much time in the room, we opted for this, which cost Â£242 for two nights (room only). The ONLY saving grace of this hotel (which I am adding to keep the review fair) is the location which is easily reachable from the train station (a few stops on the water bus and a short, easy walk to the hotel from there). However, 'small' does not begin to describe the cupboard-sized attic room we were given, which had barely enough room to move round the bed let alone put suitcases anywhere - you had to clamber over them to get round the room. The most insulting thing though was that the bed was in fact a sofa bed - we paid Â£121 a night to sleep on a sofabed. On raising my dissatisfaction I was told I would have to pay more to get a room with a proper bed!!! The room was constantly like a furnace, and so poorly designed that the window opened inwards which meant you couldn't shut the curtain - at night this meant you could either suffocate or keep the curtain open which let in the light of a security light shining right into the room all night. The window opened out over a courtyard which led into reception - again, having the window open meant you were woken by guests arriving through the night, the room filled with cigarette smoke rising from the courtyard, and everyone in the courtyard had a view into the room and could see us sleeping. The room was obviously newly built but was poorly finished - see photo of bathroom for example. The bed was turned down but the room obviously not swept/hoovered and towels were not changed. No staff were available after 8pm or before 8am. My advice? Give this shoddy outfit a wide berth! I don't know what the 'normal' sized rooms are like, but any hotel that thinks it's acceptable to use a sofa bed doesn't deserve your money - Venice has plenty of hotels to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “only good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: pragati25
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was in middle of the market but still had to walk 10 mins from railway station. had to really search for the hotel. rooms were good but very small. its a house converted into a hotel. staff is helpful. main city of venice was walkable from the hotel. good thing about the hotel was there was a grocery store just outside the hotel so had no probs with the breakfast. bathrooms were very clean and of high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting decor right on the canals”
Reviews.Author: patyoung19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are interestingly decorated. Our room was situated on the canal at water level which made looking out the window a different but a good experience. The manager Marco gave us great instructions on how to find the hotel and was very accomodating. The hotel is close to the Ponti Vecchio and not too far from Venices main piazza and has a large supermarket right alongside. Only problems would be the height of the shower. I am 6'2" and he had a little difficulty fitting in the shower and the breakfasts were pretty basic even by European standards. All in all it was a pleasant enough experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous! Certainly NOT recommended”
Reviews.Author: S-London-1985
Reviews.Content: Advertised as a boutique hotel, the pictures on their website are highly deceiving. At best this place can be described as a pokey â€˜B&Bâ€™ without the breakfast or the service. Upon arrival we were greeted by a member of staff who reeled off endless â€˜rulesâ€™ the most ridiculous being that youâ€™re expected to leave your key in a bowl when you go out, when we questioned the safety of this he tried to reassure us that there was 24 hour CCTV monitoring the bowl and so was completely safe (needless to say we never left the key in the bowl and would recommend that you donâ€™t, the â€˜hotelâ€™ is only staffed from 8am to 8pm and security is loose). Our room was tiny and we had a sofa bed as opposed to an actual bed, all of which wasnâ€™t really a problem other than the heat in the room was unbearable, we were unable to sleep at night, even with the window wide open it was far too hot (this was middle of Novemberâ€¦ dread to think what itâ€™s like in the summer). To top it all off we were locked out of our room on the first evening when the neighbouring room closed the door preventing us from getting to our room â€“ we had to rummage around the front desk for a key, not sure who was monitoring the 24 hour CCTV at this point, but they must have fallen asleep. All in all a very weird set up for a â€˜hotelâ€™ and I wouldnâ€™t recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Canal View Room - Very Noisy & Mouldy Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: jennifer_laura
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated down a small alley riddled with urine and rubbish, also if you are following the hotels website directions they forget to mention the final detail; .......then take the first calle (street) on the left, after this they fail to mention you need to then take the next right turn and you will then see the hotel after around 10 metres. The receptionist was there to greet us and offered us a welcome drink which was very kind. We were shown how to operate the electric doors and told to leave our keys in a bowl everytime we exited the hotel. During our stay with the hotel I noticed the front gates are left open during the day with no reception staff. All the room keys are just left in a bowl on the front desk totally unattended so basically anyone can come and gain access to your room! We booked the canal view room, we both liked the general modern decor of the room and the view was very nice. I was disappointed to see a long stretch of mould on the ceiling in the bathroom and mould around the bottom of the shower. Don't expect to get a good nights sleep in this room, you can hear clear conversations in the rooms to the side and above you, also the breakfast room is next door so you will be woken up by everyone eating their breakfast. We liked the idea that there was an onsite bar, where we could get ready of an evening, have a couple of drinks and onto a restaraunt. This hotel stated on their website they have a American Bar, THERE IS NO AMERICAN BAR! I wouldn't even bother approaching the manager with an issue, he is about as useful as a chocolate fireguard! When I spoke to him on the phone, he abrubtly ended the call. Extremely rude!

Reviews.Title: “Al Canal Regio is not in a run down part of Venice , its just off the main street”
Reviews.Author: RedRobbie01785
Reviews.Content: We loved Al Canal Regio it is ideally placed to walk from or catch the Vaporetto to all of the main sites in Venice , being just of the main street (Strada Nuovo). It is not as some advisors suggest in a run down part of Venice , but a stones throw from the Ghetto area .Although the rooms are a little small and their is no tea / coffee making equipment in them they are stylish and clean. The concierge boy is nice and his English good. Weather was brilliant at this time of year , to hot to sit in at times , no smell .Food and wine / lager expensive (really) , we should be in the euro.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL IN IDEAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: moselman
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this "boutique" style hotel. Nothing flash but very modern, clean and well appointed. Staff were very obliging. The location, at the end of the Strada Nova was ideal for Rialto and gondola ferry to "the other side."

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to say”
Reviews.Author: Bailey1965
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very enjoyable weekend in Venice, staying in the Al Canal Regio hotel. I would not describe it as a boutique hotel, but would say it is a very clean, well presented hotel in a great location and very good value for money. The room was large (no 26) and the bathroom was also a good size. The bed was big and very comfortable. The down sides were that the air con wasn't very effective and even though we went in Sept, it was still hot at night. There is a fridge in the room which was great to keep drinks cool in (supermarket at back of hotel much cheaper than street vendors). Also the shower facilities are pretty useless (a shower hose in bath, but nowhere to hang it on wall and no shower curtain. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay there if I went to Venice again and wouldn't hesitate in recommending it

Reviews.Title: “we never saw the booked room”
Reviews.Author: jessup83
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the hotel with a guarenteed booking. at that time the receptionist was on the phone extending a booking. he hang up and letting us know they were fully booked ad we had to got to an other hotel. we had to ask for all where it was etc. we were told to move to al canal regio the next day i refuesed as i wanted to enjoy venice. of course i asked the hotel to pay the suplement for the 2nd night at the other place. after a short telephone call they agreed. the other place was nice. well the first night was not nice. i told the receptionist the next morning he excused. at departure i mentioned our unpleasant experience again not receiving a reaction. i wrote an email to the manager of al canal regio as we paied there even though we stood in a different place.(his name and mail adress was a secret in the beginning) he was not at all reacting in a friendly way. after 24h i asked if someone is taking care about my issue as so far i did not receive any reaction. i was only receiving an answer if i were talking about myself getting the money back from my bank as i never received an invoice and they never a signature. pretty sad that this was the only way getting them to get in contact with me. I never had a hotel acting that unprofessional and telling lies to a guest. Michele the Manager is the most unfriendly and unprofessional manager i ever spoke to. as i am working in hospitality for years i know what i am talking about. so better do not book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience on a fantastic venitian Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: azimut55
Reviews.Content: We staid 3 nights at this beautiful Hotel, everything was so nice! The staff was helpful and friendly, and Marco and Michele help us to make our holiday fantastic! TheyÂ´ve told us about a very good restaurant (Al graspo de ua) where we tried venitian specialities. The room was very clean and the atmosphere created by the mix of venitian and modern style was amazing!! The breakfast was rich of every kind of food and drinks (weÂ´ve been in 4 stars hotel that has a breakfast poorer than this)! We absolutely recommend this hotel to everybody because here you will feel bettter than at home! Trust!

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: cortado10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is trying to pass its self off as a boutique hotel and it could not be further away. Their web site is a total lie, they do not offer the things as said on the site. We booked a junior suite which comes with robe & slippers, there was no robe and when mentioned we were told like everything else that you have to request it! The reception is only opertated during the day, so no one out of hours, nobody there when we arrived at 6.50pm! we had to buzz an intercom & wait 20 mins! Breakfast is terrible most drinks are from an office type vending machine. This hotel is only like a b&b it is a total rip off and we felt robbed, there are many better places to stay for less money. DONT GO.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Loumabel
Reviews.Content: I am confused by all the positive reviews I have read regarding this hotel as I can find nothing good to say about it. Its website claims it is a high class boutique hotel, but I found it to be nothing more than a substandard bed and breakfast. We arrived with our friends at 7.00pm, it was pouring with rain and we were very tired after our journey. We were buzzed in through the awful gates by a security guard (not on site, I must add but at their sister hotel about 10 minutes away.) We stood in the reception area alone for about 15 minutes waiting for somebody to arrive and check us in. When the guy finally arrived he was not apologetic at all and just said that he had been at the other hotel as if we were upset for no reason. We were let into our rooms both Junior suites and at the top of their tariff. The room was small with a mezzanine level with a double bed covered in a cheap and nasty bedspread. The bathroom was miniscule with the most ridiculous shower built into a sloping ceiling. Luckily, both my husband and myself are short people as anyone over 5'6" would have their head touching the ceiling!! The toiletries are cheap rubbish, no robes were provided even though we paid extra for them, threadbare, hard towels and the bathroom was not cleaned during our 5 night stay. The whole room was grubby and the floors were filth,y the bottoms of our feet were black from walking on them. The Television had a terrible picture and was just local tv not the satelite Tv advertised on their website The TV by the bed was locked on Child controls with no remote control to turn it off, we just had to unplug it at the walll in the end. The self service breakfast is awful, revolting croissants or a rock hard bread roll are your choices all served in the hall of the hotel where you have to perch on a tiny stool. They don't even have anyone serving coffee, its just a coffee machine like the type you find in a service station, just can't believe you don't get decent coffee in Italy!! We did complain about all of these things while we were at the hotel and the manager Michael was extremely unhelpful, he did nothing to rectify our complaints and simply shrugged and said we have to request all the things we wanted even though they are listed as standard on our room grade description. Probably the most alarming point about this hotel is that there are never any staff present. The front gates are left open during the day with no reception staff. All the room keys are just left in a bowl on the front desk totally unattended. Anybody could wander in and let themselves into your room! To finish off all I can say is that had we been paying for a cheap B&B at cheap prices then that would have been fine but we were paying top prices and could have stayed at one of venices premier hotels for the same money. This hotel represents very bad value for money and I would urge everyone to avoid it at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating during Iceland Volcano Incident”
Reviews.Author: Burberries
Reviews.Content: The hotel customer service has been very helpful and accommodating during the Iceland volcano eruption, where airtransport accross Europe was cancelled. The staff of Al Canal Regio has provided me with a great service, so that I can only recommend this Hotel for future visitors. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AishF
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend arrived very late to Venice, there was a delay with our transport.. The hotel were very accomadating to every need we had (left notes etc for us)... The staff (reception) were very helpful, maps were provided, recommendations of restaurants and what to see and do.. Room was really clean and really modern, was perfect for a weekend break away. Only 5min walk to centre of venice, venice is very small.. Could come back to hotel to change etc.. Location was great and was great value for money.. Would definitely come back to visit and stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, modern hotel, but with a lot of negative aspects”
Reviews.Author: Carleyt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very easy to find, you get off at the Ca D'oro stop and then walk down and turn left, walk to the first bridge and cross it and then turn immediately right and it is the first street on your left, you need to walk quite far down and then there is a bit of a turn to your right and you will see the hotel. When we got there we were very impressed with the decor, however we didn't arrive till midnight and the person who checked us in literally took our passports and showed us our room, which was right next to reception, we weren't told anything except how to sort the heating. Having got there very late we went straight to bed, but is was quite annoyed when at half 7 in the morning the phone was ringing constantly, and it wasn't quiet!! As we were so close to reception we could hear everything they were doing. When we were leaving our room the next day we noticed there was an upstairs, my boyfriend went and looked and there was a sofa bed, and another bathroom, we thought it may be a living area for us. However when we returned from our outing it was locked. Later on we heard someone being shown to the room and they didn't seem to impressed to have a room with a sofa bed! I don't blame them! We also found when we returned that our room had been left unlocked when the maid had made the beds! Apparently all the residents are meant to leave the room keys in the bowl on the reception desk, but we never did as reception was very rarely manned, they were always in a little room at the back and we only saw someone on reception when we left!! We were never informed of what we were able to do, there was a room across the courtyard with a coffee machine and cups and glasses, we didn't know if we could use them as we were never told and could never find anybody to ask! There is a supermarket, McDonalds and loads of little cafe's and restaurants on the main street from the hotel and even more over to Rialto bridge, these are quite well priced and if you don't want to spend a fortune don't eat around St. Marks square. However Hard Rock Cafe is a must!!! We had 2 massive meals and didn't mid paying 45euros! Also if you like your shopping St. Marks square is grea, Chanel, Prada, Luis Vuitton, Fendi, Gucci, D&G, Bvlgari, Cartier! Everything a girl could want! We went on a gondola but didn't shop around for prices, we used one of the guys who stood on the little bridges arond the streets her charged 100euros for a 45minute tour of the Grand Canal, Rialto Bridge, and lots of little street canals where certain people lived...eg. Casa Nova!!! Ha. Venice is a lovely place to visit, some beautiful sites, plan what you want to do before you go, we paid 33euros each for a 72 hours waterbus pass, which probably wasn't needed in the end as apart from the airport and bus station everything is in walking distance. We flew to Treviso Airport and got a bus from outside which is in conjunction with the flight, we paid 18euros for 2 return tickets and this took us to the bus station where you then get a waterbus to Ca D'oro. If we went again we wouldn't stay at Al Canal Regio as although our room was nice we wouldn't want to get one with a sofa bed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get (and it's worth seeing)”
Reviews.Author: cmcg25
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay for 4 days in this hotel but unfortunately refurbishments meant that we only got 2 days here. The rooms were exactly as shown on their website and the staff were very friendly and helpful and even gave us some directions and tips on where to go. Room service was very good and we were served breakfast in bed at exactly the time we specified. The bathroom was very spacious and clean and there were plenty of towels. There was a safe to keep our personal belongings secure and we were provided with an iron on request. The hotel is quite difficult to find as it is hidden behind a few turns from the high street with no signs to direct you. We were reliant on an extremely helpful local woman who guided us to the hotel. We were required to leave our keys at the hotel helpdesk in a large bowl with all the other guests' keys each time we left the site which seemed bizarre and unsafe to us but the staff assured us that they had never had any security incidents in the past. The staff are only in the hotel from 7am - 8pm so you have to press a buzzer in order to be let back into the building outside of these hours. In summary, we had a very pleasant, comfortable and enjoyable couple of days at this hotel and felt extremely safe and secure in the district of Cannaregio and we would certainly recommend a stay here to enjoy the quieter side of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, good location, small room but shows promise”
Reviews.Author: Sorcellere
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location near shopping and a couple of nice bars (and a music club, which is the only one we found in Venice). The rooms were very prettily decorated although small and a bit dark. The staff were very polite, but only man the desk during the day and the internet didn't work all that well. All though the hotel was very clean and had some beautiful decor, it looked like it was fairly new and show real promise.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexisuk
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and co operative staff. Room fine, no balconies but windows over looking a canal, but not the Grand Canal. 15-20 mins to St Marks, 25-30 mins to P Roma, very pleasant walks, any closer to St Marks and the prices rise steeply, also restaurant prices a little friendlier. Venice is expensive!! Can be 'done' in a day and a half.

Reviews.Title: “surbooking”
Reviews.Author: querenciaparis
Reviews.Content: be careful. You think you booked a room in this hotel and when you arrived no room is available. if you pay in advance you have no solution except to accept a prestation which doesn't correspond at what you want. On my mind forget it

Reviews.Title: “great find!”
Reviews.Author: karolynmckinley
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this place we decided to give it a go. It was everything and more than we expected! Great location away from the huge tourist crowds, yet still felt like we were within walking distance to everything, or at least a short boat ride away. We were pleasantly surprised to be given room #3 which has a view right on to the canal. The room was huge and airy, with 10 foot high windows opening directly onto the canal. The room was modern and elegant. And out of all the places we stayed in Italy, had the most comfortable bed! (why are all the beds so hard in Italy???!) The staff was friendly and helpful, the map they provided was invaluable in getting around Venice. Did not have a chance to enjoy the breakfast they served (additional $10 euros) but it looked pretty decent. All and all I was extremely pleased with our choice and the value, considering you can pay just as much for other places that are far less amenable. Also, right around the corner is one of the top recommended local restaurants - La Cantina. Be prepared to wait a LONG time to have your food served, but its definitely worth the wait!

HotelInfo.Name: Al Canal Regio
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio, 3632/A, 30121 Venice, Italy
